note.p: Career: Commissioned in the Grenedier Guards (1845); Captain (1850); served in the Crimean War; Major (1857); Lieutenant Colonel (1867); Major General (1877); Lieutenant General (1882); founded the Hythe School of Musketry; his collection was housed by the government first at Bethnal Green, then South Kensington, finally given to Oxford University and placed in the Pitt-Rivers Museum (1883)

References: Quentin Bone, 'Excavator Extraordinary', review of Mark Bowden, Pitt Rivers: The Life and Archaeological Work of Lieutenant-General Augustus Henry Lane Fox Pitt Rivers, DCL, FRS, FSA in NR 1995 vol 49 pp 159-162, plate
Clive Gamble and Theodora Moutsiou 'The time revolution and he stratification of the primeval mnd' NR, 2011, Vol 65, pp43-64
